[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 35]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Shop and Planning the Next Few Rounds**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 3/8, Round 4, $22 in the bank after using Temperance. Let's see... I've got Smiley Face, Mystic Summit, Luchador, Constellation (the pesky negative one, but it gives me an extra joker slot, which is crucial), and Certificate. Six total slots, maxed out. No consumables, which isn't ideal, but manageable.

The shop is offering a Half Joker, Spare Trousers, a Standard Pack, and, most importantly, the Hieroglyph voucher. The Hieroglyph immediately catches my eye. Reducing the Ante by 1 is *massive* early game. More rounds mean more money, more shops, and more time to build my deck with Certificate and find those sweet Planet cards for Constellation. Yes, it costs me a hand, but I'm usually crushing these rounds in one or two hands anyway. That's fine.

My current focus is on Full Houses – that's where the high scores have been. The Spare Trousers, which scales with Two Pair, is a perfect fit. Since Full Houses *always* contain a Two Pair, it'll be scaling every time I play a Full House. I can slot this into my sixth slot.

The Standard Pack is just good general deck-building material – useful for finding more face cards to synergize with Smiley Face.

So, the play here is clear. The Hieroglyph voucher costs $10, which leaves me with $12. Spare Trousers cost $6, leaving $6. Standard pack costs $4. Buying the Hieroglyph is non-negotiable; its scaling effect is what I need. Spare Trousers are excellent for this deck build. I should check if I can afford it. Yes, I can; Constellation gives me an additional slot, so I'm not over the limit. Buying the Standard Pack is also good for building the deck.

The Hieroglyph voucher is the most impactful move here. Let's buy that.
Action: `buy_voucher`, positions: [1]
Reasoning: Hieroglyph resets the Ante, allowing for more time to scale the deck. I can afford it.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
